title: Winnie Harlow teases a glimpse of her braless assets in fuchsia satin blazer and matching flares
text:
As one of the models of the moment, she is known for taking risks with her fashion ensembles.

And Winnie Harlow put on a racy display as she attended the West Hollywood Edition preview party in Los Angeles on Tuesday.

The model, 25, oozed confidence as she teased a glimpse of her braless bust beneath a sharply tailored fuchsia pink satin blazer.

Busty: Winnie Harlow put on a racy display as she attended the West Hollywood Edition preview party in Los Angeles on Tuesday

The beauty drew further attention to her decolletage with a selection of shimmering gold chains.

The star paired this with matching high-waisted flared trousers and a pair of perspex heels.

Her raven tresses were styled in soft waves while her pretty features were enhanced with a slick of berry gloss.

The star completed her ensemble with a pair of edgy shades.

Revealing: The model, 25, oozed confidence as she teased a glimpse of her braless bust beneath a sharply tailored fuchsia pink satin blazer

Shimmer: The beauty drew further attention to her decolletage with a selection of shimmering gold chains

The model recently filmed a make-up routine with Vogue in honor of New York Fashion Week. During the video, she detailed the different tricks she uses on her vitiligo patches — a skin disease that causes discoloration.

'What I like to do is use Visine Eye Drops on the skin, on the white parts of my skin, to take the redness out,' the brunette beauty said while dropping the liquid onto her face.

Prior to adding Visine to patches of her face to help brighten the area, Winnie first cleanses her skin, followed by a homemade mask made up of manuka honey, Aztec Secret Indian Healing Clay and apple cider vinegar.

Meanwhile, the media personality openly discussed the changes in the modelling industry and the standards of beauty.

Cleavage: Winnie looked sensational as she risked a wardrobe malfunction in the blazer

Speaking to ELLE Magazine earlier this year, she said: 'There is a big shift happening in the fashion industry in terms of beauty standards, and I feel I’m part of that shift.

'I remember on America’s Next Top Model, Tyra Banks asked me if a photographer told me to cover my skin for a shoot, would I do it? I said no. I don’t care who it is, or who thinks I should. I’m going to stay true to myself.'

The media personality was first propelled into the limelight after being discovered by Tyra on Instagram and being asked to appear on her show-America's Next Top Model in 2014. The model went on to finish in sixth place on the series.

Brunette beauty Winnie recently spoke out against being branded 'a sufferer' of the pigment disease, as she penned on Instagram: 'I'm not a "Vitiligo Sufferer" I'm not a "Vitiligo model."

'I am Winnie. I am a model. And I happen to have Vitiligo. Stop putting these titles on me or anyone else.'
description: Winnie Harlow put on a racy display as she attended the West Hollywood Edition preview party in Los Angeles on Tuesday.
